page.title: 05BIDEFORD HARBOUR
page.content: BIDEFORD{HARBOUR}IS UNUSUAL BECAUSE SHIPS COME RIGHT UP TO THE TOWN CENTRE WHERE{THE QUAY}IS SITUATED. {CAPTAIN HARRIS}ENJOYS HIS JOB AND HAS BEEN THE{HARBOUR MASTER}AT BIDEFORD FOR TEN YEARS AND THE{RIVER PILOT}FOR TWENTY-EIGHT YEARS. ABOUT{SEVENTY {SHIPS}COME INTO BIDEFORD IN A YEAR. THE NEW{BRIDGE}WILL AFFECT TWO OR THREE SHIPS. THE{'POLAR BEAR'}HAS BEEN STATIONED AT BIDEFORD FOR EIGHTEEN MONTHS AND CARRIES ALL KINDS OF{CARGO, TO SUPPLY{LUNDY ISLAND,}EVEN TRANSPORT GOES THERE. IT MAKES THE TRIP TWELVE TIMES A MONTH. WHEN A SHIP COMES INTO BIDEFORD A LOT OF{SPECIFICATIONS}ARE PUT DOWN INTO THE{HARBOUR REGISTER.} THE HEAVIEST BOATS THAT COME INTO THE HARBOUR WEIGH{1500 TONS.}FOUR BOATS HAVE GOT STUCK IN OUR HARBOUR AND A COUPLE HAVE EVEN{SUNK.}MOSTLY CLAY IS {EXPORTED}AND FERTILISER{INPORTED.
